page.title: 09Changes in Burton Pidsea
page.content: When Mr. Wray and Mrs. Wright were young the village was made up of a scattering of farms and a small number of houses close to the Church and the village pub. Everyone knew everyone else - in fact, most people were related to one another. This gave a strong sense of community spirit that was totally classless. It is this same quality which makes the village so popular today.Everyone may no longer know everyone else, but there are many opportunities to meet for those who wish to do so. Some people believe the village has grown too large, but the majority still feel that it has managed to retain its friendly village atmosphere. Unfortunately services haven't kept pace with development and this makes a car essential for villagers.
